fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34383].
  {panel}

In the article:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforJIRA-20130513projectkey

It states that project keys with letters, numbers and the underscore are supported but does not elaborate if Greenhopper now supports these. 

Could we either get that document updated or update the Greenhopper documents?
fields.summary: Clarify if Greenhopper supports new Project Key format
Add a time limit for editing comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34379].
  {panel}

Could we improve this document:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Database+Integrity+Checker

So it gives more information on how the integrity checker works? For example it says 'check for invalid filter subscriptions' and 'check FilterSubscriptions for references to non-existent QuartzTriggers'

But what is an 'invalid filter' or a 'QuartzTrigger' ?
fields.summary: Improvement request for documentation
As a user, I would like to be able to create projects

fields.description: unable to select confluence pages in side of jira using the confluence page gadget
fields.summary: Unable to use confluence page gadget in jira

fields.description:
It would be nice if Integrity checker could catch rows where :
ProjectRoleActor contains rows where ProjectRoleID is null
fields.summary: Add check for ProjectRoleActor to catch rows where ProjectRoleID is null

fields.description:
It would be nice if the integrity checker can catch issues where :
 CustomFieldValue contains rows where ID is null
fields.summary: Add check for CustomFieldValue to catch rows where  CustomFieldValue contains null ID

fields.description:
We can not use the fisheye plugin in our jira, because the commit statements in the source tab of each project are very old - in our fisheye I can see the right fresh commit statements

the connection is ok - we have checked everything ... 

we tried everything in the Fisheye Configuration in our Jira - Refresh global configuration - refresh cache and so on ... nothing happens

is it ok: when I clicked on the button "View Fisheye cache statistic" there is even the value "0" in the row of "Current" - see also the attached image??? I don't think so - I think this is the problem, that the cache of the fisheye plug in has may be a bug? (see also my other ticket JSP-169594 with the problem, that we can not change the revision cache size of default 5000 to another value)
fields.summary: Extrem old commits in source tab - Fisheye Plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34371].
  {panel}

As of latest JIRA, users can't be deleted if they have assigned/reported issues plus if there's any comment made by them.

Assigned or reported issues can be filtered out rather easily and further action can be taken.

However, it is difficult to remove comments by particular user before the user can be deleted. Admin needs to go through all issues that contain comment/s from that user and delete them.

On top of that, searching for comments made by users prove to be really hard as JQL doesn't provide the feature to search issues by comments' author.
fields.summary: Improve delete users function for users with comments
Number of users suddenly exceeded

fields.description:
Atlassian JIRA (v5.2.2#843-sha1:2c344e5) 
I need to find all issues from linkedissues wich don't have such comment with text "документирование не требуется" 

query issue in linkedissues (Direct-21629) and not(issue in linkedissues (Direct-21629) and comment ~ "документирование не требуется") returns 149 issues
But query issue in linkedissues (Direct-21629) returns 149 issues
And query issue in linkedissues (Direct-21629) and comment ~ "документирование не требуется"  returns 101 issues

Here are screens of query and results:
http://content.screencast.com/users/yaajing/folders/Jing/media/ba8059c4-7e68-4d54-bf8c-82f509623313/2013-08-19_1551.png
http://content.screencast.com/users/yaajing/folders/Jing/media/b634501c-138a-45b6-aab8-1092a45c76c8/2013-08-18_1924.png
http://content.screencast.com/users/yaajing/folders/Jing/media/faf1de3f-7633-49c5-b569-e83f0b186892/2013-08-18_1635.png
fields.summary: text search with negation
I'd like to be able to choose the number of transition buttons on JIRA on-demand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34361].
  {panel}

I'm not sure how much of a memory leak this is causing, but it may be a contributor to memory increases in OnDemand during it's weekly run-cycle.

Summary of fix:

If we're using an {{ImageWriter}} it should have {{dispose()}} called on it when finished with.

Also using {{ImageInputStream}} in {{DefaultThumbnailManager}} we need to close them:
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/issue/thumbnail/DefaultThumbnailManager.java#402
fields.summary: Thumber and DefaultThumbnailManager are leaking native resources.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34360].
  {panel}

The frother control doesn't steal the ID of the select that it's replacing, so the form label still targets the hidden {{<select>}}. This is an accessibility problem.

# Add the Affects version to a screen visible through a transition.
# Open the dialog.
# (BUG) Click on the 'Affects Version' label. The single select control is not selected.
fields.summary: Single Select control (single select) doesn't support getting focus when its label is clicked.
Allow for the ability to hide JQL search box
Make possible to clone a user account.
Separate Workflow management permission

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We’ve now addressed this in the [new issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/The+new+Jira+issue+view]!
- When the date of the action is <= 7 days ago, you’ll be able to switch between relative and absolute formats by clicking on the timestamp.
- When the date of the action is > 7 days ago, it will always show the timestamp in absolute format, as per our design guidelines.

If you don’t have the new issue view yet, you can try it out by clicking on your avatar > Personal settings then turning on New Jira issue view under Labs. For more info, check out [The new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/The+new+Jira+issue+view].
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34350].
  {panel}

The relative time will be display before a week of the issue created, updated and commented time. 

!relative_time.JPG|thumbnail!

After a week, it would display the absolute time (exact time). 

!exact_date.JPG|thumbnail!

Currently, our JIRA system do not have an options to change the relative time to exact time permanently. 

h4. Workaround
Hover the mouse to the created, updated and commented time where tool tips would show the exact time.
fields.summary: Create an option for user to determine the issue exact time.
LegacyAdminLinkFactory uses ServletActionContext to get Request. It should use ExecutingHttpRequest.get()

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34347].
  {panel}

JIRA would not show the navigation menu when *Analytics* module being disable from Manage Add-On (System) UI page.

*Steps to Reproduce the problem:*
# Go to Manage Add-Ons then choose filter by System.
# Expand Atlassian Navigation Links Plugin and others modules.
# Disable *Analytics (analytics)* module.
!Analytics module.JPG!
# Refresh the browser.
# The following error is shown:
{noformat}
2013-08-15 21:40:59,487 http-bio-8084-exec-5 ERROR admin 1300x989x1 1ri3btw 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace [jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering] Unable to build top navigation from 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.headernav.ModernPluggableTopNavigation' because of 'com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Required plugin module com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-nav-links-plugin:analytics was either missing or disabled'
com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Required plugin module com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-nav-links-plugin:analytics was either missing or disabled
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$ComputedUncheckedException.get(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:3305)
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$ComputingValueReference.compute(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:3441)
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$Segment.compute(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:2322)
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$Segment.getOrCompute(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:2291)
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap.getOrCompute(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:3802)
	at com.google.common.cache.ComputingCache.get(ComputingCache.java:46)
...
Caused by: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Required plugin module com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-nav-links-plugin:analytics was either missing or disabled
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$ComputedUncheckedException.get(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:3305)
...
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Required plugin module com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-nav-links-plugin:analytics was either missing or disabled
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.TemplateSetFactory$TemplateSetBuilder.addTemplatesForTree(TemplateSetFactory.java:99)
...
{noformat}

!navigation_menu.JPG!
fields.summary: Disable Analytics module under Atlassian Navigation Links Plugin (system plugin) causes navigation menu not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34344].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce

# Create a field
# On the Configure scren (where you put the name and description), mouse hover the 'Create' button'. Note it says "Press Ctrl+s to submit this form".
# Press Ctrl+s

Current result: nothing
Expected result: form is submitted

Tested with Firefox on Mac
fields.summary: Shorcut Ctrl+S does not work on Mac in any dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34343].
  {panel}

The field "Issue Type" is abbreviated in most issue lists (or issue navigator) as "T". The "Priority" field is abbreviated as "P". But when you're on a form (such as Create Issue), the label for the field is the full name. See screenshot. This makes me think the underlying structure to have a full name and an abbreviated name exists.

Can this be made available for Custom Fields?

Forum message:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/196042/abbreviating-headers-in-issue-lists

Previously logged 2 years ago as: JRA-21429, closed with "no you can't, customise Jira source code yourself".
fields.summary: Custom fields, abbreviate column headers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34342].
  {panel}

Filters are good for basic reporting, but keeping the relevant fields is a challenge if you are always forced to view a global set for you.

It would be nice to be able to be able to associate the column view configuration in the filter itself.This would allow people use different filters with just the relevant information depending on the context:

- Quick reports
- Issue navication
- Subscriptions
- etc.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to save different column views in each different filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34341].
  {panel}

It would be nice that JIRA came with a default "start date" field. Even when you are able to add this as a custom field, you cannot really rely on it being there for every project, and in big organizations that is a problem.

A start date field could be used to implement several useful features that could enable organic collaboration, such as:

- Send an alert to the assignee on the start date if the issue is open/reopened
- Send an alert to the project administrator with X days advance if the issue is unassigned and open/reopened
- Be able to plan with TeamCalendars (due date is not enough, created date is meaningless for planning)
- Be able to implement a Gantt view out of the box
- Be able to do basic capacity planning based on filters that show a dynamic window of time

Planning a start date, even if it is just a guess, is a vital piece of information for project management.
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I'd like to be able to set a start date for my issues

fields.description:
Hi,

I am using AD account  for email notification authentication, but the account always locked out, and the email notification will be failed, Please help check if it is a configuration issue or bug?

For outgoing mail configuration:
{code}
SMTP Host
      Protocol: SMTP
      Host Name : My exchange server 
      Port : 25
Note:  No username and password used.
{code}

For incoming mail configuration:
{code}
     Protocol : POP
     Host Name: My exchange server 
     Port: 110
     username: <user@domain>
     password: AD password
{code}

I can login the OWA mailbox by this AD account. and i am sure the password is correct.
fields.summary: AD account always locked out in configuration of email notification

  {panel}

There is a resource spike (CPU, Memory) after performing plugin activity such as update, install, disable and enable. The performance should be recover after JIRA finished re-building the webresources module - normally takes 3-4 minutes.

at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.transformer.CharSequenceDownloadableResource.streamResource(CharSequenceDownloadableResource.java:45)

at com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.CachedFile.doEnter(CachedFile.java:120)
- locked <503a6451> (a java.lang.Object)
at com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.CachedFile.stream(CachedFile.java:82)
at com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.FileCacheImpl.stream(FileCacheImpl.java:92)
at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.cache.CacheHandle$Builder$2.stream(CacheHandle.java:48)
at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.AbstractBatchDownloadableResource.streamResourceInternal(AbstractBatchDownloadableResource.java:125)
at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.AbstractBatchDownloadableResource.serveResource(AbstractBatchDownloadableResource.java:97)
at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.servlet.PluginResourceDownload.serveFile(PluginResourceDownload.java:96)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.AbstractFileServerServlet.doGet(AbstractFileServerServlet.java:33)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:621)
[...]
  Locked ownable synchronizers:
- locked <368c02dd> (a java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker)
{code}

h4. Cause
There may be a concurrency problem in the way we use Rhino in the LESS compiler, such that is it very blocky/slow under concurrent load.

The results of LESS compilation are cached. But the cache is cleared (for example) when installing a plugin. At that point, concurrent calls to (different) CSS batches cause many threads to be concurrently entering the LESS compiler.
fields.summary: Under high concurrent load, LESS compiler performs terribly
History searches do not support the 'project' field.
View Projects in System Default Field Configuration "Scheme"
Separate Custom Field management permission
Revision cache size not saving configuration
Add the ability to change the project type after the project creation.
Assign existing created filters in the activity stream
Ability to search for epics without stories
Add an option to move or hardlink attachments instead of copying them upon project import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34323].
  {panel}

This is on configuring Application Link between JIRA and Confluence via HTTPS.

Encountered the issue with BAD URL Signature recently on both JIRA and Confluence where the two instances connecting to each other over SSL (HTTPS). 

There has been a KB article on this in the following explaining the cause
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Application+Link+authentication+fails+due+to+bad+URL+signature

I'm requesting to include the above KB article link to both of the following documentations with a warning if the user is on reverse proxy (or simply, using domain name instead of IP address to access JIRA/Confluence):
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+LDAP+or+JIRA+or+Other+Services+via+SSL
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+SSL+services

There is also suggestion to have the two parameters (as follows) to be in {{server.xml}} by default (included in the _Connector port_ for SSL)  so that all customer would need to configure this when trying to configure SSL services.
{noformat}proxyName
proxyPort{noformat}
fields.summary: Update documentation on connecting to other SSL services

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34319].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the default membership for project roles will only apply to new projects and will not affect existing projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to update existing projects so that default members of roles can be retrospectively added to existing projects.
 
h3. Workaround
Manually update each existing project with any new users for the specific project roles.
fields.summary: Enhance default membership for project role so that it can push changes to the defaults to existing projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34318].
  {panel}

When using the action menu (period) after opening up an issue, the issue reverts to the top of the window, unless you click and point focus somewhere else.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open any case without focus (no direct link to comment. Also helps if case has enough content to necessitate scrolling down to see bottom of issue).
2. Scroll to bottom without clicking anywhere on the issue
3. Bring up action menu using period shortcut
4. Note that the screen jumps to the top of issue or up to top of comments section
5. Next, scroll to bottom of issue. 
6. Click and put focus on the last comment on the issue.
7. Now hit action menu and note that position of the screen stays at bottom of the issue.

Expected results:
When scrolling to the bottom of an issue, without clicking to put focus down there, bringing up action menu does not move the screen back to the top. I reference the last comment in my next bounce and having to constantly ensure my focus is down on the last comment is tiresome. 

Please let me know if more details are necessary.
Chrome 28 exhibits behavior. Firefox 22 does not.
fields.summary: Bringing up action menu using period moves screen focus
Import Data screen should list files in $JIRA_HOME/import, instead of having to manually type a filename in
Allow users to set the maximum number of issues displayed on the Filter Results Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34313].
  {panel}

1. Select Create Issue (on a page that launches the lightbox and not one that directs to a new page)
2. Enter any required fields
3. Attach a file via the lightbox
4. Check the 'create another' box
5. Hit 'Enter'
6. On the next ticket light box, scroll to the attachments field 
7. You'll see that the attachment has appeared and been selected in the attachment field

I could not replicate this in sdog or a btf instance. I was able to replicate it on 4 other randomly selected ondemand instances
fields.summary: Attachment data is cached between tickets when 'create another' option is selected

fields.description:
We are getting mismatching times in JIRA between the comments and system times.  I have verified the the Linux server where JIRA is living has the correct time.  Is this a known bug?

Note from user:
It appears as if the system time, JVM time and/or jira time of the jira host box are not synchronized?

Thanks!
Chip
chipw@allrecipes.com
206-436-7428
fields.summary: JIRA Comment Time Not Matching Server Time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34311].
{panel}

{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

Worklog endpoints have been added:

* Under the *Issue* group:
*- Get issue worklog
*- Add worklog
*- Get worklog
*- Update worklog
*- Delete worklog
*- Get worklog property keys
*- Get worklog property
*- Set worklog property
*- Delete worklog property

* Under the *worklog* group:
*- Get IDs of deleted worklogs
*- Get worklogs
*- Get IDs of updated worklogs

For details please see:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/

{panel}

We are trying to get a list of work log items for a date range across projects through the rest API. What is the preferred methodology to do this? I don't see a standard function for this. If there isn't an easy way to do this I would like to propose a REST function to return a worklog list.
fields.summary: JIRA Rest API for worklog items
Add an option to let customers choose which would be their default workflow view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34307].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage. The overall experience of Importing/Exporting both singular and multiple projects is something we will be looking at in the future however, and we would love for you all to keep commenting and helping us make sure that when we do tackle this, we do so in the most focused way possible. 

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

In order to move a project between two different instances, an user must export a whole XML backup from the source instance, and will only import one project in the target. 

For huge instances, where there are over 400 projects, exporting a full XML backup may result in performance issues during the time it takes for the backup to complete, and as exporting all 400 projects is not necessary to only import one project, it would be good if it was possible to export only one single project to be imported into another instance.
fields.summary: Allow Single Project Export
Ability to export an ASCII text version of the workflow
Default values
Ability to share the current state of the workflow as a URL
While on the 'Basic' search, the 'Label' field should show all registered labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34300].
  {panel}

When you do a search like: level = xxxx using advanced search in JIRA's issue navigator (in the case whereby the xxxx security level actually exists but the user doesn't belong to this security level, and therefore cannot see this issues). JIRA returns the following message: "The value 'xxxx' does not exist for the field 'level".

This could offer certain security in-case where certain users are not supposed to know about the existence of such level. But generally this can be very misleading, especially to JIRA Admins. 

A more accurate and yet secure error message may be something like: 
{noformat}"The value 'xxxx' does not exist for the field 'level' or you do not have required permission"{noformat}... This might also remind JIRA admins to add themselves to the security level, even if only temporarily before they run queries like that.
fields.summary: Advanced search for issues belonging to a level, give misleading error if the user doesn't belong to the level
Support postgres 9.2
Activity Tabs - History/Activity
Comments added along with attachments should be linekd to that attachment and displayed alongside it.
Reset issue counter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34284].
  {panel}

Currently, when assigning custom field, we have two contexts to which a custom field can be assigned:

* Global context. Apply to all issues in JIRA.
* Apply to issues under selected projects

This is good when you want to apply a custom field to every projects or a limited number of project.

However, when a project come which do not want a specific custom field, there is no easy solution to exclude said field.

You could
* Create series of specific screens for that project that hide the custom field
* In the custom field configuration, slect every other projects except the one you don't want the field in. 

The first solution could lead to the creation of many duplicated screens with only a single field changed, leading to more maintenance cost when adding global fields in the future.

The second also add to maintenance cost (and risk) by having to go add every new project that need the custom field in the future.

Thus, I would like to add a 3rd feature:
* Exclude this field to issues under selected projects

Any project selected would see the custom field excluded.

It would save maintenance and ensure field aren't forgotten when dealing with special custom fields.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude custom field per project in custom field configuration
Finding your Server ID documentation
Field can be changed in bulk edit, although not available in the edit screen

fields.description:
Hi!
This is our setup:
- We have several custom fields translations in 3 languages.
- We have several custom fields settings by type of incident

When we create an issue of one type settings take rightful custom fields and field descriptions do not appear in the language we have in our profile, but appears in the language in which you created the configuration fields at that moment.
If we change the language of the user profile, descriptions of the fields still appear in the same language.
Excuse my English.
Thank you.
Regards, 
Antonio.
fields.summary: I have problems with the translation of custom fields
Ability to select the 'System Dashboard' when setting a wallboard slideshow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34276].
  {panel}

Here is the steps to reproduce the issue:
# Install a new JIRA instance and create new project.
# Set up the mail handler to pick up the local file.
# Add the file test.eml in the folder <JIRA home directory>/import/mail.
# Wait for 1 minute to let the handler to read the file to create a new issue: 
!Screen_Shot_2013-08-13_at_11.03.42_AM.png!
It seems that the attachment file is not picked up by JIRA.

*PS:* The file test.eml can be correctly open via Outlook and it shows that there is an attachment file inside.
fields.summary: Mail handler is not able to pick up the attachment
Performance of comment and change history searches is poor in large instances.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34270].
  {panel}

issue editing The *Back To Issue* button returns to a different place. 

To replicate:

Run a Search to Detail screen
More
Add watchers
Back to Issue

This returns to the single issue screen, not the Detail view where you came from _as one might expect._   The sidebar is gone too.

This may may be a transitional way of encouraging users to use in-page editing rather than a bug, not sure. :)  It seems a bit mixed between old and new issue update styles and doesn't _flow_ well...
fields.summary: "Back to Issue" behaviour from Detail Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34269].
  {panel}

When working with a customer logset, we found that we could not paste a portion of the logs into a comment without JIRA failing to create the comment.

I am providing a sample bit of text to reproduce this. This text has a null character in it which is the root cause of this. Depending on what text editor you open the file with, the issue may or may not reproduce. Sublime Text 2 seems to cut the copy operation off at the null character, so this does not happen. Textmate reproduces it 100% of the time.

Script console:

{code}Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token < batch.js:5
e.extend.parseJSON batch.js:5
$.ajax.error batch.js:1056
o batch.js:5
p.fireWith batch.js:5
w batch.js:7
d batch.js:7{code}

Reproduced this in AOD and SAC
fields.summary: Null character in paste will break comment action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34268].
  {panel}

Given that I was logged in
  and I am not logged in now, due to the session timing out
When I search for a bug by number in the quick search fiedl

Expected:
Then I am prompted to log in and my search is performed and results are returned.

Actual:
I am presented with a page that says: "
Project Does Not Exist
Error
The project or issue you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators."
fields.summary: Issue / project not found message in issue searches for anonymous users should prompt user to login
Add ability to sort x axis for Two Dimensional Filter gadget
Allow JQL to be used within workflow transition Condtions

fields.description: The icon is not displayed; the tip is still there - see screenshot. Occurs in FF-22,23 and IE-9.
fields.summary: Activity order icon not displayed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34260].
  {panel}

The list of projects in JIRA is very large and its difficult for a user to search a specific project (from View Projects list).

Below features doesn't help -
1. Type project name to Quicksearch at top-right corner. It returns list of latest tickets present in that project. But it is hard to go to project browse page from issue navigator, unless I am already very familiar with JIRA.
2. Referring recent projects under the Projects dropdown in the main menu doesn't help as sometimes user most likely has never or not for a long time had to report to a given project area, so it probably won't be there.

Hence the ability to search list of projects in JIRA has to be improved. May be in "View All Projects page" or in main JIRA page (like quick search).
fields.summary: Improve the ability to search list of projects in JIRA

fields.description:
Hi All,

I see Connection timeout to SMTP server port 25. Ping to SMTP server works fine but JIRA doesn't send mail and works slowly.

In Mail admin page I see:

This page shows you the current JIRA internal event queue, whose events may trigger notification emails.

The queue currently has 1194 items in it.

The mail queue is currently sending.

    Bypass currently sending mail - Push sending of current mail to the background, to let others through. Mail details will be logged for debugging.




Thanks,
Inessa
fields.summary: JIRA stopped sending mails.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34256].
  {panel}

# Create a database and add some tables (an old JIRA db will do).
# Start JIRA without a db configured.
# (BUG) On the first database setup screen, connect to the database above. You should get an error about the database not being empty. JIRA still has a couple of connections to the database open after the failure.

I expect failure on the database to clear all connections to the database.
fields.summary: On setup, a failure with a non-empty database leaves connections to the DB open.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34255].
  {panel}

JIRA should run as an Avatar server for all of our products to allow for a "consistent" experience amongst our applications. This is particularly relevant for organisations that use JIRA as a user server.

This includes:
* FishEye/Crucible
* Confluence
* Stash
* Bamboo

Unfortunately at present customers need to use the individual product Gravatar support to work around this problem.
fields.summary: JIRA as an Avatar server for all Atlassian Products
Share a Dashboard through Email
Display custom fields even when empty with ability to edit inline
Show Project Key in the dropdown when creating an Issue
Fix broken link on documentation
Allow text-field custom fields to be displayed in heatmap gadget
Give example in the instruction on execute the script

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34244].
  {panel}

When going into the configure columns screen and adding the comments column, nothing is ever displayed.

It is understandable that you cannot display all comments in this view, however, the expected behavior I think would be to see the latest comment.

This would actually be extremely valuable for reporting. Management usually expects to know the latest status in reports, and this can be generally extracted from the last comment.

I would recommend to display max 250 characters in the issue navigator + " - by <author full name>", but display the full comment in exported views and in the Confluence integration too.

Thanks,

David
fields.summary: Issue navigator column for comment field never displays anything

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

As per [JRA-22153|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22153], the results returned might be in the List View. 

*Suggestion*
It would be better if Issue Navigator returns result in distinct columns, such as the screenshot below

!results.png!
fields.summary: Returns the subtasks of parent issues in separate columns
The component field is named "Component/s", but should be "Component(s)"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34236].
  {panel}

Hi there,
we have around 250 projects on our Jira-Server and its hard for us to find old and inactive projects to archive them.

For now we have to click on every project and view the activity stream.
It would be nice to have the last activity date on the global project-list (URL/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa) Maybe also the amount of Tickets of that project.


Kind regards
André
fields.summary: Last Activity on gloabl project-list
Changing Jira Issue priority via Email
As an Admin, I would like more granularity over the types of changes that trigger the Issue Updated event
Custom issue type and priority icons should be stored under JIRA_HOME/data on JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34229].
  {panel}

Currently, when seeing *Released Versions* and *Unreleased Versions* in a versions field (e.g.: Affects Version/s) the order is different. For example, if this is configured in the Project versions:
|!projectVersions.png|thumbnail!|

This is how it will be displayed in the *Affects Version/s* field:
|!affectsVersions.png|thumbnail!|

*Proposed Fix:*
We should make both of them order equally so there won't be any confusion. Either by making both sorted ASC or DESC.
fields.summary: Order 'Released Versions' and 'Unreleased Versions' equally
RendererManager for Custom Release Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34227].
  {panel}

Example: 

When closing a JIRA issue, it would be helpful to copy all links that block other issues and make them be related to those issues. 

In other words, create new related to links for only the links that are blocking another issues. 

Presently one can create new links based on List of Lined issue Keys. For example, could we include an additional field that would allow the customer the ability to select which issue types to duplicate from?
fields.summary: Can I create new links from existing links based on specific link types?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34226].
  {panel}

Currently the documentation here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Sub-tasks#ConfiguringSub-tasks-Configuringsub-taskfieldsdisplayedonparentissues

only says that *The jira.table.cols.subtasks property can accept the values indicated in right-hand column of the IssueFieldConstants table on the Constant Field Values page (of JIRA's API documentation).* In reality, only certain fields are supported, not all. 

For example, the *attachment* field (which is shown in the issueFieldConstants table) cannot be added to the configuration.

A customer commented on the documentation with the following fields that are known to work:
versions, components, issuekey, issuetype, status, resolution, assignee, progress, timespent
fields.summary: Update documentation of Subtasks page to include information of what fields can be configured to be viewed in parent issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34224].
  {panel}

Having the ability to set some kind of password policy is great, there are a few more features that would be very helpful though.

* Configurable password expiration, simply a number of days before a password change is required.
** Allow certain accounts to not expire.
* Configurable password history requirements. We can currently configure similarity checks against the previous password, it would be helpful to configure similarity checks against the previous x number of passwords.
fields.summary: Improvements to the Password Policy features

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34222].
  {panel}

h3. Meta
(i) This issue duplicates AOD-6676, so please close it wherever it isn't appropriate:

* I've been unsure where to file it and in hindsight JRA might have been the better choice, but I'm unable to move it myself and almost a week has passed w/o any feedback whatsoever, so I hope to get some attention to this potentially severe issue here eventually.
* I realize that you are having a hard time getting on top of the issue queues currently, yet I consider security and data integrity issues critical and expect an initial acknowledgement/triage at least - lacking this minimum feedback,  I'm not comfortable recommending JIRA/OnDemand to my clients/teams right now.

----

h3. Original Issue (filed as AOD-6676 at 2013-08-02T00:49Z)
\[...\]

I've received a few watch notification for [AMKT|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT] issues *just closed as _Won't Fix_* by [~jkodumal] ~4 hours ago, e.g. [AMKT-4509|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4509]/[AMKT-4510|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4510]/[AMKT-4602|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4602]/[AMKT-6358|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-6358] - I've visited a few issues for details now and am slightly disturbed by what I've seen:

* (x) they are *still listed with _Status=Open_ and _Resolution=Unresolved_*
* (x) likewise the last updated date seems to reflect the previous activity only
* (!) yet all issue tabs properly reflect John's closing, i.e._Comments_, _History_, _Activity_ and _Transitions Summary_ properly recorded him closing the issues as _Won't Fix_
* (i) sure enough the issues still show up as _Unresolved_ via JQL now, i.e. the current status is handled consistently at least, see e.g. 
{code}
project = "Atlassian Marketplace" and resolution = Unresolved and issuekey = AMKT-4602
{code}
* (x) other than non formerly closed open issues they don't offer the _Return to Triage_ transition anymore, so the workflow system seems to know about the intended current state _Closed_ not offering that transition in fact

How is this possible? Am I missing something or is this a severe data integrity violation?
fields.summary: Fix apparent data integrity violation with closed issues not actually being closed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34221].
  {panel}

I'd like Questions and Answers to be new items in Jira. Linked with assignees and Jira keys. 
This would make more efficient dialogue through Jira, and quicker responses. 

Background: 
Our main goal for using Jira is to get a structured and efficient dialogue, where information becomes available in most convenient location for everyone. Comments can of course bring dialogue into Jira, but people might get lost in the not always structured flow of items here, and the questions are hidden for people not actively reading the issue.

Questions and Answers might improve communication in the following way
- It will indicate a very clear request for a piece of information, that will be met with another defined piece that fills this need. 
- It may indicate that this can and should be handled quickly
- Different questions can be addressed to different people, without having to reassign the entire issue.
- It can be made visible in many different contexts, to get attention. Having five question listed on the dashboard can inspire a quick response for all of them. It's harder to get a response if five issues are added to an already long list of issues with the questions hidden somewhere within a lot of comments. 

Use case: 
In an issue  I need different clarifications to move on. I trigger a question box and write [@user This is my question]. 
After finishing a question I can write another one, or close the box.
The addressed users can be noticed about a new question in many ways, easily being able to give a quick response or route the question to someone else.
A new tab in the issue can give an overview over the questions asked along with responses. 

The minor implementation is only Question and Answer items, which should make a fairly simple implementation but further functionality might be considered, at least when planning the architecture. 
- The responsible for the question could sign off the response with a value. (Something like OK | NotOk | NewQuestion)
- Follow up questions could be put in context
- There might be a description field for more thorough background information for the question itself, to make sure the main question is kept clear and simple.
fields.summary: Q&A functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34220].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When commenting on an issue via email and attaching an eml file in the email itself, the eml file gets attached to the issue but has no extension.

This causes inconvenience when trying to view the attachment in it's original format (email which is to be opened via email client)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send an email to a mail handler inbox which has an eml file as an attachment

h3. Expected Results
# Issue gets created
# eml file attached to the issue with proper extension

h3. Actual Results
# Issue gets created
# eml file attached but does not have any extension

h3. Notes
Not able to reproduce in JIRA 7.1.7 in Firefox

h3.Workaround
# Download and save the file without an extension
# Rename the file with the proper extension
# Open it with preferred email client
fields.summary: Emails with attached emails is saved without eml extension
Clone issue from linked JIRA
Exact phrase searches should only match on the non-stemmed content of the target field
Please update Importing Data from CSV docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34215].
  {panel}

While I appreciate the value of the Priority field, we have a few issue types, where that field is not required or desired. We have removed it from our screen configurations for Create, Edit, and View. It is not appearing on the Create and Edit screens, but it still appears on the View screen, which does not logically relate back to what has been configured. 

To resolve this disconnect, either: 
(1) Designate that certain fields cannot be removed on View screens of issue types (short term solution); or
(2) Remove the Priority (and if this applies to other default fields) from the View screen in complliance with the configuration (preferred solution)
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, when I remove the "Priority" field on an issue's View screen, I expect it to not appear on that screen so that my configuration matches the user's experience
Graph hours by component per month
Stop words should not be ignored on exact phrase searches
Stemming should not be done on exact phrase text searches
Drag and drop inline image in JIRA Comments
Provide ability to determine the exact time an issue was created
